main event: A round silver colored object was reported very high in the sky, not moving very fast.
interesting points: The object was observed at 1956 PDT on 21 July 1952, 15 miles northwest of Red Bluff, California, moving northwest.
The sighting was overseen by Mr. Schlosser.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting included clear skies and winds at specific degrees and knots.
The weather officer advised that weather balloons had been released shortly before the sighting.
No photographs or other evidence of the sighting were reported.
